Eğer Puzzle tarzı oyunlar seviyorsanız size kesinlikle tavsiyemdir. Benim gibi Puzzle sevmeyen bir insanı bile 44 saat ekranda tutmayı başardı (Oyunu en az 5 defa bitirdim, her defasında teorileri ve hikayeyi öğrendim.). 
Aynı zamanda eğer oyunun "Tek" oyunculu kısmından sıkılırsanız oyunu "İki" oyunculu olarak da oynayabilirsiniz (Benim gibi yıkık olanlar için pek geçerli değil ama neyse.).

Si querés una experiencia diferente por parte de Valve y el Source Engine, debés jugar este juego. Una muy buena historia con puzzles ideales para un jugador que no juega este tipo de juegos. No es obligatorio jugar Portal 1 para poder entender la historia, pero si podés jugarlo, también jugalo

For a puzzle game Portal 2 is great. The mechanics are really simple to understand and the game really does make you think about the current puzzle. The multiplayer is also fantastic, even if the normal Co-op is rather short there are a ton of good community maps. The price of it is well worth for all the content you get.
Its alot of fun just to  use your mind
Man I love this game so much! It has such a great story that I just hope there is going to be a Portal 3 once! If you are watching the recommendations before buying, BUY IT! It's worth your money!

Amazing game. Awesome game. 10/10. Flawless for what it stands. Medium-hard puzzles driven by amazing and hillarious characters in a perfectly drawn scenario. When you think about it, you just can't say it's bad in anything.

The choice to go with Stephen Merchant over someone that's actually funny like Steve Coogan was a missed opportunity.

Portal 2 is saved by being on a decent game engine, and advancing an immersive sci-fi story, but honestly I'd rather rewatch Alan Partridge than play through this again.

This game is absolutely amazing, I literally have had no problems playing it, all the levels were fun, yet challenging, and the gameplay is smooth, and has never seemed to fail me. I do feel like you move a little slow at times, though. Not only is the campaign great, but so is the multiplayer, and the custom levels you can get just adds to the replay value of this game. Overall, I highly recommend getting it, definitely worth your money.

Please note this is only a review based on the Singleplayer Campaign, as I have not yet tried the multiplayer coop.
I really enjoyed the first Portal, so I was looking forward to Portal 2.  Overall I did enjoy this sequel. It was a bit long boring and tedious in some places, but overall I had a good time with it. It presented some new ideas and challenges over Portal 1 and its fun new story driven adventure was excellent, funny and very entertaining. I especially like how it delves into the historical parts of Aperture Science Labs, so you can see how it all began. 

[b]Pros[/b]
Good story.
Great, well acted and funny dialogue.
Funny and entertaining moments. 
New Puzzle Challenges; Some were quite fun.  

[b]Cons[/b]
Some of the new puzzle challenges just felt too long boring and tedious. Some just left me feeling too clueless to want to be bothered. A lot of them just felt boring and not worth the effort, even though some of them are kind of like a rollercoaster ride at the end and give you a huge dopamine hit when you figured them out. I hate to admit it, but did have to seek walkthroughs for help on about 3 of the puzzles.  Unfortunately, though, it really did feel like a drag throughout a lot of the game.  I went through a lot of the game just wanting it to be over.  I found myself too often walking into a new puzzle area and saying things like; “OMG are you f**king kidding me? How the hell am I supposed to figure this one out?”   Instead of “Yay! The next puzzle, let’s see how I solve this one!” which I’m pretty sure the later was my regular reaction to the puzzles in Portal 1. 
It has old Portal 1/Half Life 2 dated Graphics.  Still looks good to me, but would have been nicer if they were a little more up to date for the time. 

[b]Conclusion[/b]
Overall Portal 2 is a great game and it’s definitely worth a buy if you liked Portal 1.  It has the qualities of the first game and more, but unfortunately, for me it was more tedious and more of a drag than the first game.  No game at any point should make you want to wish it was over long before it is over. That’s my only real complaint. 

On another note: Also strangely, even though I have completed Portal 2, Steam seems to think I haven’t even played it for 5 minutes.  That will explain why I have only unlocked one achievement when there should be more.  Way to go Steam!  Maybe I should request a refund too, since I have played it all and you don’t even know.
This game is absolutely amazing. Cmon, you can't call yourself a true gamer if you haven't played the portal games. Get them already!
it is a great game for those who love adventure action and puzzle solving.
